subject: Travel
title: Columbus and the Wrong Continent
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Columbus and the Wrong Continent.

hook.text: Columbus wasn't trying to discover America. He thought he could reach Asia by sailing west.

buildup.text: He calculated the Earth was much smaller than it actually is. Every expert told him he was wrong.

discovery.text: In 1492, after five weeks at sea, he landed in the Bahamas, convinced he'd reached India.

twist.text: He made four voyages and died still believing he had reached Asia. He never accepted the truth.

climax.text: The continents were named after Amerigo Vespucci, who realized it was a 'New World.'

punchline.text: Columbus found a continent by being spectacularly wrong.

quiz.question: What did Columbus believe he had found?
